org.eclipse.ecf.filetransfer
Interface IFileTransferContainer

All Known Implementing Classes:
XMPPClientSOContainer, XMPPSClientSOContainer
public interface IFileTransferContainer

File transfer container entry point interface. This interface is an adapter to allow providers to expose file transfer semantics to clients. It may be used in the following way: 

 IFileTransferContainer ftc = (IFileTransferContainer) container.getAdapter(IFileTransferContainer.class);
 if (ftc != null) {
    // use file transfer container to setup use outgoing or incoming file transfers
    ...
 } else {
    // container does not support file transfer container functionality
 }

Method Detail

requestOutgoingFileTransfer

void requestOutgoingFileTransfer(ID remoteTarget,
                                 IFileTransferListener transferListener)
                                 throws ECFException
Request outgoing file transfer. This method is used to initiate a file transfer to a given remoteTarget specified by the first parameter. File transfer events are subsequently delivered to the provided file transfer listener

Parameters:
remoteTarget - the remote target for receiving the file transfer. Can be null for some providers
transferListener - a listener for file transfer events. Must not be null
Throws:
ECFException - if the provider is not connected, or the provider is not in the correct state for initiating file transfer.

addIncomingFileTransferListener

void addIncomingFileTransferListener(IIncomingFileTransferListener listener)
Add incoming file transfer listener. If the underlying provider supports receiving file transfer requests

Parameters:
listener - to receive incoming file transfer request events

removeIncomingFileTransferListener

boolean removeIncomingFileTransferListener(IIncomingFileTransferListener listener)
Remove incoming file transfer listener

Parameters:
listener - the listener to remove
Returns:
true if listener actually removed, false otherwise

requestIncomingFileTransfer

void requestIncomingFileTransfer(IFileID remoteFileID,
                                 IFileTransferListener transferListener)
                                 throws ECFException
Request incoming file transfer. This method is used to initiate a file transfer for a given remoteFileID specified by the first parameter. File transfer events are subsequently delivered to the provided file transfer listener. The given remoteFileID and transferListener must not be null.

Parameters:
remoteFileID - the remote target file (e.g. http://www.eclipse.org/index.html). Must be null
transferListener - a listener for file transfer events. Must not be null
Throws:
ECFException - if the provider is not connected, or the provider is not in the correct state for initiating file transfer.
